title: How to Cancel a Bid on eBay

steps.title: Open eBay.
steps.content: Open eBay. Go to https://www.ebay.com/ . If you're already signed into eBay, this will open your eBay home page. If you aren't signed in, click Sign in in the top-left side of the page, enter your email address (or username) and password, and click Sign in .

steps.title: Click Help & Contact.
steps.content: Click Help & Contact . It's a tab in the upper-left side of the page.

steps.title: Click Retracting a bid.
steps.content: Click Retracting a bid . This link is in the middle of the page.

steps.title: Click Retract a bid.
steps.content: Click Retract a bid . It's a blue button in the middle of the page. Clicking it opens a page with recently bid-on items.

steps.title: Select an item on which you recently bid.
steps.content: Select an item on which you recently bid. Click the item's name to select it.

steps.title: Select a reason for canceling the bid.
steps.content: Select a reason for canceling the bid. Click the circle button to the left of one of the following reasons: [1] X Research source I entered the wrong amount. - Select this option if you bid too high or too low. The description of the item changed significantly after I placed my bid. - Select this option if the item's reported condition, description, or selling terms change in a way that impacts the item's value. I'm unable to contact the seller by email or phone. - If you've tried to contact the seller and you have been unsuccessful, select this option.

steps.title: Click Continue.
steps.content: Click Continue . This blue button is below the bid cancellation reason section.

steps.title: Click Retract bid.
steps.content: Click Retract bid . It's a blue button near the bottom of the page. Doing so will retract your bid.

steps.title: Open eBay.
steps.content: Open eBay. Go to https://www.ebay.com/ . If you're already signed into eBay, this will open your eBay home page. If you aren't signed in, click Sign in in the top-left side of the page, enter your email address (or username) and password, and click Sign in .

steps.title: Select My eBay.
steps.content: Select My eBay . It's a tab in the upper-right side of the page. Doing so prompts a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Selling.
steps.content: Click Selling . This option is near the bottom of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Select an item.
steps.content: Select an item. Click the name of an item on which the bid was placed. You may have to scroll down to find your item.

steps.title: Scroll down and find the item number.
steps.content: Scroll down and find the item number. This number is to the right of the "eBay item number" heading that's in the top-right side of the "Description" tab. You'll need this information to direct eBay to the correct item.

steps.title: Find the bidder's username.
steps.content: Find the bidder's username. Click the [bid] link above the Place bid button, then find the name of the person who placed the bid that you want to cancel. You'll need this information to cancel the bid.

steps.title: Click the eBay logo.
steps.content: Click the eBay logo. It's in the top-left side of the page. This will take you back to the home page.

steps.title: Scroll down and click Site map.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Site map . It's at the bottom of the "Tools & apps" column of options that's at the bottom of the eBay home page. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and click Cancel bids on your listing.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Cancel bids on your listing . This option is in the "Sell activities" group of options beneath the "SELL" heading.

steps.title: Fill out the bid cancellation form.
steps.content: Fill out the bid cancellation form. Complete the following fields: Item number - Type your item's number into the field above this heading. User ID of the bid you are cancelling - Type the bidder's username into the field above this heading. Reason for cancellation - Enter a brief (80 or fewer characters) reason for the cancellation in the field below this heading.

steps.title: Click cancel bid.
steps.content: Click cancel bid . This will immediately cancel all bids placed on your selected item by the user in question.

steps.title: Open eBay.
steps.content: Open eBay. Go to https://www.ebay.com/ . If you're already signed into eBay, this will open your eBay home page. If you aren't signed in, click Sign in in the top-left side of the page, enter your email address (or username) and password, and click Sign in .

steps.title: Select My eBay.
steps.content: Select My eBay . It's a tab in the top-right side of the page.

steps.title: Click Bids/Offers.
steps.content: Click Bids/Offers . You'll find this option near the top of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Select an item.
steps.content: Select an item. Click an item on which you recently bid. You may have to scroll down to find the item.

steps.title: Click the seller's username.
steps.content: Click the seller's username. It's below the "Seller information" heading on the right side of the page. Clicking this takes you to the seller's profile page.

steps.title: Click Contact.
steps.content: Click Contact . This option is in the upper-right side of the seller's page. Doing so will open a contact page.

steps.title: Scroll down and click Contact the Seller.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Contact the Seller . It's in the "Didn't find the answer?" section. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click Continue.
steps.content: Click Continue . Doing so opens a message field.

steps.title: Type in your question.
steps.content: Type in your question. Type something like "I would like to cancel my bid(s) on your item," followed by the item's name. If you have a link to the item, use that instead. You may have to fill out additional information depending on the seller.

steps.title: Click Send message.
steps.content: Click Send message . This will send your message. While the seller is under no obligation to cancel your bid, they will usually honor your request.
